intro: Fuirena umbellata var. americana, commonly known as the American umbellate fuirena, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while the small white or yellowish flowers bloom in clusters. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported healing properties.
